alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued December 13 at 3:20AM CST until December 14 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...BLIZZARD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM MST /MIDNIGHT CST/ THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions expected. Total snow accumulations ranging from 2 to 8 inches with locally higher amounts possible. Northwest winds gusting as high as 65 mph. * WHERE...Yuma County and Kit Carson County in Colorado, Dundy County in Nebraska, and Cheyenne County in Kansas. * WHEN...Now through 11 PM MST tonight. * IMPACTS...Dangerous travel conditions associated with heavy snow, blowing snow, and strong northwesterly winds. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow may be preceded by a brief period of freezing rain. In other words, hazardous travel conditions may exist before it begins to snow.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
